event.summary: 10/12/1993: Ulster Volunteer Force (UVF) paramilitaries shot dead one man and injured five others in a multiple murder attempt on a mini-bus full of Catholic workmen who worked for Shorts Aerospace Factory in Belfast.
event.target1: Mini Bus carrying workmen to Shorts Aerospace Factory
event.motive: The attack was perpetrated as revenge for IRA attacks.
event.scite1: David McKittrick, “Catholic Shot Dead in Ambush; Attack on Workmen in Mini-bus seen as Loyalist Warning to Workers at Shorts Aerospace Factory,” The Independent (London), October 13, 1993.
event.scite2: Martin Cowley, “Painter Dies in UVF Gun attack in Van,” The Irish Times, October 13, 1993.
event.scite3: Kevin Cullen, “In Ulster, Loyalist Vow to Sink Initiative,” The Boston Globe, October 13, 1993.
